message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: InputStream is = new FileInputStream("D:\\Users\\Vinoth\\workspace\\Testing\\Testing_2.doc");
DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(is);
OutputStream os = new FileOutputStream("D:\\Users\\Vinoth\\workspace\\Testing\\Testing_3.doc");
DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(os);
byte[] buff = new byte[dis.available()];
dis.readFully(buff);
boolean start = false;
try{
    for(int i = 0; i < buff.length; i++){
        if(buff[i] == (byte)'Ð' && buff[i+1] == (byte)'Ï'){
            start = true;
            i++; // skip the next character
        }
        if(start){
            dos.write(buff[i]);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are trying to compare a byte to a char, which will not work as expected because they are not the same type. Instead, you should compare the byte to the byte representation of the char. Also, you need to increment the index by one after finding the special characters to skip the next character.
